The Protecting Our Kids Act was just advanced by the House Judiciary Committee yesterday, setting up votes on the House Floor next week. I strongly support this legislation to prevent gun violence; you can read more about it here: https://t.co/ZuMRZptxce

This builds on other gun violence prevention work in the House. We already passed legislation to require a background check for every gun sale, which I voted for twice. Next week we vote on Extreme Risk Protection Order ("red flag law") legislation I've championed for years.

The Protecting Our Kids Act also has sections to promote safe storage of guns, a key to responsible gun ownership that the gun debate has long overlooked.

And it would back regulatory actions at ATF to prohibit bump stocks and ghost guns with the force of legislative action.

The bill would establish new federal offenses and penalties for straw purchasing and gun trafficking. Many guns used in crimes in cities like Chicago, New York City, and Washington, D.C. are purchased in places with weaker gun restrictions and then transported across state lines.

The bill would ban high capacity ammunition magazines. 

The man who killed six people and shot 18 others including Congresswoman Gabby Giffords in Tucson was tackled when he had to reload. Just before his 33-round magazine was emptied he shot a 9-year-old girl, killing her.

It would raise the age to purchase many semiautomatic rifles - including AR-15 models - from 18 to 21. 

I am a cosponsor of the Assault Weapons Ban, and support fully banning these weapons of war from civilian use, but raising the minimum purchase age would also save lives.
